artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Ōmiya Heihachi
creditline: Gift of Sue Y.S. Kimm and Seymour Grufferman
description: group of three figures, one in center has back turned, wearing a mauve colored jacket with an under robe with scattered leaves printed on it in pigments of green, orange and peach; elaborate gold headdress; two figures on left, both wear same colors and patterns as center figure, each with blue headdresses with stacked blue leaves; 'picture' of yellow and pink flowers in URC; inscriptions in Japanese characters in ULC, right center edge and in LRC
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Five Seasonal Festivals (Gosekku no uchi 五節句の内)
title: Chrysanthemum Festival: The Tamaya in Shin-Yoshiwara Edomachi itchōme; the courtesan Shinmachi and her attendants Kitsune and Komatsu
